intro: Androsace vitaliana var. centriberica, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. This species thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
